task1_youtube_transcripts_argentina.title: Argentina indigenous groups protest against lithium mining

transcript_chunks.speaker: Narrator
transcript_chunks.text: In Argentina, members of an indigenous community have been on a march to demand greater rights. It follows a change in legislation in Jujuy province that limits the right to protest.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Indigenous Leader
transcript_chunks.text: We are protesting against the lithium mining projects in Jujuy because they threaten our ancestral lands and water resources without proper consultation.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Community Member
transcript_chunks.text: The constitutional reform in Jujuy ignores ILO 169 and our right to free, prior, and informed consent for extraction activities.

task1_youtube_transcripts_argentina.title: Lithium exploitation: Indigenous communities on alert in Argentina

transcript_chunks.speaker: Reporter
transcript_chunks.text: Indigenous communities in Jujuy are on high alert as lithium mining expands, demanding consultation under international law.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Activist
transcript_chunks.text: Projects like Olaroz and Cauchari-Olaroz were approved without meaningful consultation, violating our rights to our territories.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Expert
transcript_chunks.text: The Kachi Yupi Protocol outlines how consultations should occur, but companies prefer individual negotiations over collective consent.
